item.title: John Gunther
item.description: This program features readings from John Gunther's "Death Be Not Proud."
item.dc:creator: Gunther, John, 1901-1970
item.dc:subject: Authors.

item.title: Paul Green
item.description: This program features a script by Paul Green about an African-American family in the South.
item.dc:creator: Green, Paul, 1894-1981
item.dc:subject: Dramatists

item.title: Pearl Buck
item.description: This program presents a script by Pearl Buck about the treatment of the aged in modern America. Buck also introduces the play.
item.dc:creator: Buck, Pearl S. (Pearl Sydenstricker), 1892-1973
item.dc:subject: Authors.

item.title: Betty Smith
item.description: This program features a radio play by Betty Smith about Abraham Lincoln. Smith introduces the play.
item.dc:creator: Smith, Betty, 1896-1972
item.dc:subject: Authors.

item.title: Robert Frost
item.description: This program features Robert Frost talking about the "importance of separateness."
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Poets--20th century.

item.title: Archibald MacLeish
item.description: Archibald MacLeish reads poems about what he thinks America is and was.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Poets--20th century.

item.title: Arthur Miller
item.description: This program features script by Arthur Miller based on his own play, "The Crucible."
item.dc:creator: Miller, Arthur, 1915-2005
item.dc:subject: Dramatists

item.title: Norman Corwin
item.description: Norman Corwin scripted a documentary study on the conributions made to America by the Jewish people.
item.dc:creator: Corwin, Norman, 1910-2011
item.dc:subject: Authors.

item.title: Noel Houston
item.description: This program features Noel Houston speaking on and presenting a play he wrote about "an American who discovered himself and found a purpose for his life."
item.dc:creator: Houston, Noel
item.dc:subject: Authors.

item.title: Randall Jarrell
item.description: This program features a script by Randall Jarrell about an education in present-day America.
item.dc:creator: Jarrell, Randall, 1914-1965
item.dc:subject: Poets--20th century.

item.title: Conrad Richter
item.description: This program presents a script by Conrad Richter about "the inner turmoil of a modern scientist."
item.dc:creator: Richter, Conrad, 1890-1968
item.dc:subject: Authors.

item.title: Carl Sandberg
item.description: This program presents Carl Sandburg reading his own writings.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Poets--20th century.

item.title: William Saroyan
item.description: This program presents a play about a "miracle" by William Saroyan. Saroyan also introduces the play.
item.dc:creator: Saroyan, William, 1908-1981
item.dc:subject: Authors.
